decisions.label: Alert Supervisor

decisions.label: Use Paper Towels

decisions.label: Use Spill Kit
decisions.description: Find the chemical spill kit

decisions.label: Leave and Report
decisions.description: Exit and report to supervisor

decisions.label: Clean Immediately
decisions.description: Start cleaning without changing PPE

decisions.label: Wear Proper PPE

decisions.label: Check SDS First

decisions.label: Wait for Supervisor

decisions.label: Follow Protocol
decisions.description: Check protocol and begin containment

decisions.label: Call Emergency Services

questions.text: What should be your first action when encountering a chemical spill?
options: Immediately try to clean it up
Assess the situation and identify the chemical
Call 911
Ignore it if it's small

questions.text: When using a chemical spill kit, what is the most important precaution?
options: Work quickly to minimize exposure time
Call a supervisor before using the kit
Wear appropriate PPE and check the SDS
Use all materials in the kit at once

questions.text: What does SDS stand for in laboratory safety?
options: Safe Disposal System
Safety Data Sheet
Spill Defense Strategy
Systematic Decontamination Sequence

questions.text: When is evacuation the most appropriate response to a chemical spill?
options: For any spill, regardless of size
When the spill is large or involves highly hazardous materials
Only when instructed by emergency services
Only after attempting to clean up the spill

questions.text: What should you do with contaminated cleanup materials after addressing a spill?
options: Dispose of them in regular trash
Wash and reuse them
Place them in a hazardous waste container
Leave them for custodial staff

title: Electrical Safety in Facilities
description: Learn to identify and respond to electrical hazards in campus facilities maintenance.

decisions.label: Use Available Tools
decisions.description: Proceed with the repair using slightly damaged tools

decisions.label: Report Hazard
decisions.description: Report the electrical hazard to supervisor

decisions.label: Find Proper Tools
decisions.description: Delay the work to obtain proper tools first

questions.text: What should you do if you notice damaged electrical tools?
options: Use them carefully to avoid further damage
Report them and find proper replacement tools
Repair them yourself before use
Use them only for minor tasks

questions.text: When working with electrical systems, what is the most important safety procedure?
options: Wearing rubber gloves
Working quickly to minimize exposure
Verifying power is off and using lockout/tagout procedures
Using only one hand to prevent electrical shocks

questions.text: What is the proper response to finding an electrical hazard in a campus facility?
options: Fix it immediately
Mark the area and report it to maintenance
Shut off all power to the building
Leave it for someone else to find

description: Prepare for and respond to weather hazards during outdoor research and campus activities.

decisions.label: Continue Working
decisions.description: Continue the fieldwork despite weather warnings

decisions.label: Seek Shelter
decisions.description: Find immediate shelter from the approaching storm

decisions.label: Return to Campus
decisions.description: Pack up and return to campus immediately

decisions.label: Use Metal Equipment
decisions.description: Continue using metal equipment for measurements

decisions.label: Switch Equipment
decisions.description: Switch to non-conductive equipment

decisions.label: Delay Measurements
decisions.description: Put away equipment until storm passes

decisions.label: Shelter Under Tree
decisions.description: Take cover under a large tree

decisions.label: Return to Vehicle
decisions.description: Go back to the research vehicle

decisions.label: Find Building
decisions.description: Locate the nearest campus building

decisions.label: Return Silently
decisions.description: Return without notifying team members

decisions.label: Notify Supervisor
decisions.description: Contact supervisor about your decision

decisions.label: Group Decision
decisions.description: Gather the team for a group decision

questions.text: What is the recommended action when you hear thunder during outdoor fieldwork?
options: Continue work but move to a higher elevation
Seek shelter immediately and count seconds between lightning and thunder
Use only plastic or wooden equipment
Continue work but move to open ground away from trees

questions.text: Which of the following is the safest place to shelter during a thunderstorm?
options: Under a tall, isolated tree
In a sturdy building or hard-topped vehicle
In an open field away from tall objects
Under a small group of trees

questions.text: What is the '30-30 Rule' for lightning safety?
options: Seek shelter when temperature drops 30 degrees in 30 minutes
Count 30 seconds between lightning and thunder; wait 30 minutes after last thunder before resuming activity
Stay 30 feet away from 30-foot tall objects
Shelter for 30 minutes with a group of 30 people minimum

questions.text: What communication protocol should be followed when deciding to suspend outdoor fieldwork?
options: Make individual decisions without notifying others
Only notify the senior-most team member
Contact your supervisor and ensure all team members are accounted for
Continue until university administration issues an alert

questions.text: What equipment precaution should be taken during a potential lightning storm?
options: Continue using metal equipment but maintain contact with the ground
Wrap metal equipment in rubber or plastic coverings
Put away all metal equipment and avoid contact with conductive materials
Hold equipment close to your body to protect it from rain
